attributes.action: Clean energy aid for South Africa during The South African energy crisis
attributes.additional_details: The ongoing issue in South Africa not only affects their economy but it also affects ours, Ties between South Africa and the UK include a shared language (English) and cultural links, similar systems of law and finance, and a shared passion for the same sports as well as a common interest in promoting trade and a rules-based international system. South Africa is on her knees and as an ally with the capabilities and resources we should be looking to help the rainbow nation in crisis
attributes.background: Funding for clean electricity in South Africa,  Today, more than 80% of South Africa's electricity is generated by coal-fired power stations - an astonishing figure, this amount of energy is not only harming the environment but is barely enough to sustain electricity in South Africa

rejection.details:
The UK has contributed £1 billion towards a plan geared towards "coal plant de-commissioning; funding alternative employment in coal mining areas; investments which will facilitate accelerated deployment of renewable energy and investments in new sectors of the green economy." 
This information can be seen here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/joint-statement-south-africa-just-energy-transition-investment-plan

We could accept a petition calling for the amount the UK is providing in funding to be increased.
